1.1: Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, to Philemon, our dear friend and fellow worker,
1.2: and to Apphia our sister, and to Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the church in your house.
1.3: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
1.4: I thank my God, always making mention of you in my prayers,
1.5: because I hear about your love and faith which you have toward the Lord Jesus and for all the saints.
1.6: I pray that the fellowship of your faith may become effective in the knowledge of every good thing that is in us for Christ.
1.7: For I have great joy and encouragement from your love, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed through you, brother.
1.8: Therefore, although I have great confidence in Christ to order you to do what is proper,
1.9: instead I appeal to you because of love, since I am such a one as Paul, now an old man and also a prisoner of Christ Jesus.
1.10: I am appealing to you concerning my child whom I became the father of during my imprisonment, Onesimus.
1.11: Once he was useless to you, but now he is useful to you and to me,
1.12: whom I have sent back to you himself, that is, my heart,
1.13: whom I wanted to keep with me, in order that he might serve me on behalf of you during my imprisonment for the gospel.
1.14: But apart from your consent, I wanted to do nothing, in order that your good deed might be not as according to necessity, but according to your own free will.
1.15: For perhaps because of this, he was separated from you for a time, in order that you might have him back forever,
1.16: no longer as a slave, but more than a slave, a beloved brother, especially to me, but how much more to you, both in the flesh and in the Lord.
1.17: If therefore you consider me a partner, receive him as you would me.
1.18: But if in anything he has caused you loss or owes you anything, charge this to my account.
1.19: I, Paul, write this with my own hand: I will pay it back, lest I mention to you that you owe me even your very self besides.
1.20: Yes, brother, I ought to have some benefit of you in the Lord; refresh my heart in Christ.
1.21: Confident of your obedience, I am writing to you because I know that you will do even beyond what I say.
1.22: At the same time also, prepare a guest room for me, for I hope that through your prayers I will be restored to you.
1.23: Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, greets you,
1.24: and so do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow workers.
1.25: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
